meanings.definition: To place or lay (one thing) over another, typically so that both are still evident.
meanings.sent1: She superimposes the new logo on top of the old one.
meanings.sent2: He always superimposes his opinions on others without considering their feelings.
meanings.sent3: The cat superimposes its paw on the sleeping dog's nose, causing a funny reaction.
meanings.sent4: His loud laughter superimposes itself over the quiet library, startling everyone.
meanings.sent5: The artist superimposes vibrant colors on the canvas, creating a stunning masterpiece.

meanings.definition: To add (something) to the top of something else.
meanings.sent1: The chef superimposes a dollop of cream on the dessert.
meanings.sent2: She always superimposes extra tasks on her already busy schedule.
meanings.sent3: The child superimposes sprinkles on top of the ice cream, making it even more delicious.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds superimpose a sense of gloom on the sunny day.
meanings.sent5: The teacher superimposes helpful notes on the students' papers to guide them in their learning.
